messageBody:
James,
i used jfor to generate rtf.

On 10/14/05, James Abley <james.abley@...> wrote:
>
> On 14/10/05, Balraj Goulikar <gbalraj@...> wrote:
> >
> > Mark,
> > The viewers (in my case the client) are forcing me for another format.
> rtf
> > of pdf or document.
> >
> > i took a short cut. i am using the xml file generated by junit report
> and
> > processing it.
> >
> > this one calls org.apache.xalan.xslt.Process.main(pass);
> > <target name="genXSLTCFO" depends="testresults">
> > <echo>"XSLFO for the tests"</echo>
> > <java classname="test.custom.TestsProcess" fork="yes" >
> > <classpath refid="project.class.path.client"/>
> > </java>
> > <echo>"XSLFO for the summary of tests"</echo>
> > <java classname="test.custom.SummaryProcess" fork="yes" >
> > <classpath refid="project.class.path.client"/>
> > </java>
> > </target>
> >
> > this one calls org.jfor.jfor.main.CmdLineConverter.main(pass);
> > <target name="generateRTF" depends="genXSLTCFO">
> > <echo>"RTF for the tests"</echo>
> > <java classname="test.custom.TestsCmdLineConverter" fork="yes">
> > <classpath refid="project.class.path.client" />
> > </java>
> > <echo>"RTF for the summary of tests"</echo>
> > <java classname="test.custom.SummaryCmdLineConverter" fork="yes">
> > <classpath refid="project.class.path.client" />
> > </java>
> > </target>
> >
> > i am doing probably the same thing what junit report task does. use xml
> > and
> > xsl (frames and no frames) and make it html.
>
>
> Have you considered using Apache FOP? That should give you RTF and PDF
> options.
>
> James
>
>
> On 10/14/05, Mark Salter <marksalter@...> wrote:
> > >
> > > Balraj Goulikar wrote:
> > > > nobody wud want to sit and save as every report into
> > > > word doc. probaby one more similar ant task with a bit of changes?
> > > You could write some code in VBA to run in Word which could open each
> > > html file in a directory, and then save as a word document, but why
> > > would you?
> > >
> > > Can you explain why you want the results in 'word', why force your
> > > viewers to use word, when a browser of their choice could suffice?
> > >
> > > I think it would take more than a 'bit' of changes to translate html
> > > into the ever changing, and probably badly documented microsoft 'word'
> > > file format.
> > >
> > > --
> > > Mark
